name: insuperably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is so great or severe that it cannot be defeated or dealt with successfully: We have been left with an almost insuperably difficult set of problems to solve. This dish should not insuperably challenge any chef. See
insuperable
More examplesFewer examplesAll the estimates are disputed, so journalists are in an insuperably difficult position.the insuperably arrogant presenter of the showA candidate with a limp, damp handshake may well create an insuperably bad impression.
